full_text: Disease: Hyperthyroidism. Also known as: Overactive thyroid. Category: Global | Sub-category: Endocrinology. Explanation: A condition in which your thyroid gland produces too much of the hormone thyroxine.. Precautions: massage, eat healthy, take radioactive iodine treatment, use lemon balm

simplified_explanation: Low blood sugar, which can happen if you take too much insulin or don't eat enough.
full_text: Disease: Hypoglycemia. Also known as: Low blood sugar. Category: Global | Sub-category: Endocrinology. Explanation: Low blood sugar, which can happen if you take too much insulin or don't eat enough.. Symptoms: Shaking, dizziness, confusion, sweating. Treatments: Consuming glucose or sugar-containing foods, adjusting medication or insulin dosage. Precautions: check in pulse, drink sugary drinks, consult doctor, lie down on side

simplified_explanation: A condition in which your thyroid gland doesn't produce enough of certain crucial hormones.
treatments: Hormone replacement therapy with synthetic thyroid hormone (levothyroxine)
regular monitoring of thyroid hormone levels and adjustment of medication dosage
lifestyle modifications (such as healthy diet and regular exercise)
management of associated symptoms (such as cholesterol-lowering medications or antidepressants)
education and support for long-term management
full_text: Disease: Hypothyroidism. Also known as: Underactive thyroid. Category: Global | Sub-category: Endocrinology. Explanation: A condition in which your thyroid gland doesn't produce enough of certain crucial hormones.. Symptoms: Fatigue, weight gain, sensitivity to cold, dry skin, constipation, depression, muscle weakness, elevated cholesterol levels. Treatments: Hormone replacement therapy with synthetic thyroid hormone (levothyroxine), regular monitoring of thyroid hormone levels and adjustment of medication dosage, lifestyle modifications (such as healthy diet and regular exercise), management of associated symptoms (such as cholesterol-lowering medications or antidepressants), education and support for long-term management. Precautions: eat healthy, reduce stress, exercise, get proper sleep

simplified_explanation: A common and highly contagious skin infection that mainly affects infants and children.
precautions: soak affected area in warm water
remove scabs with wet compressed cloth
full_text: Disease: Impetigo. Category: Global | Sub-category: Dermatology. Explanation: A common and highly contagious skin infection that mainly affects infants and children.. Precautions: soak affected area in warm water, consult doctor, use antibiotics, remove scabs with wet compressed cloth

simplified_explanation: An infectious illness caused by a virus, often called the "kissing disease."

simplified_explanation: The inability to fully digest the sugar (lactose) in dairy products.

full_text: Disease: Leprosy. Also known as: Hansen's disease, Kushtha rog. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A chronic, progressive bacterial infection that affects the nerves, skin, eyes, and lining of the nose.

simplified_explanation: A bacterial disease that affects humans and animals, which is spread through the urine of infected animals.
full_text: Disease: Leptospirosis. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A bacterial disease that affects humans and animals, which is spread through the urine of infected animals.

full_text: Disease: Listeriosis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A serious infection usually caused by eating food contaminated with the bacterium Listeria monocytogenes.

simplified_explanation: A bacterial infection you get from the bite of an infected tick.

Precautions: meditation, reduce stress, consult doctor, use poloroid glasses in sun

simplified_explanation: The spontaneous loss of a pregnancy before the 20th week.
full_text: Disease: Miscarriage. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gynecology. Explanation: The spontaneous loss of a pregnancy before the 20th week.

full_text: Disease: Mumps. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Symptoms: Swollen salivary glands (usually parotid), fever, headache, fatigue. Treatments: Supportive care, pain relievers, isolation, vaccination (MMR)

Treatments: Supportive care, physical therapy, assistive devices, medications for symptom management, gene therapies (in some cases)

Symptoms: Excessive daytime sleepiness, sudden loss of muscle tone (cataplexy). Treatments: Stimulant medications, antidepressants, lifestyle modifications, scheduled naps

simplified_explanation: A viral infection that can be transmitted from animals to humans, which can also be transmitted through contaminated food or directly between people.

simplified_explanation: A complex disease involving an excessive amount of body fat.

Symptoms: Excessive body weight, increased risk of chronic conditions. Treatments: Antifungal medication eg  Amphotericin B, Fluconazole, supportive care

simplified_explanation: A mental health disorder that features a pattern of unwanted thoughts and fears (obsessions) that lead you to do repetitive behaviors (compulsions).
full_text: Disease: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD). Also known as: OCD. Category: Global | Sub-category: Psychiatry. Explanation: A mental health disorder that features a pattern of unwanted thoughts and fears (obsessions) that lead you to do repetitive behaviors (compulsions).

Symptoms: Joint pain, stiffness, swelling. Treatments: Pain relievers, physical therapy, weight management, assistive devices, surgery (in severe cases)

simplified_explanation: A cancer that begins in the ovaries.

simplified_explanation: Cancer that begins in the organ lying behind the lower part of the stomach (pancreas).

Explanation: A psychiatric disorder in which debilitating anxiety and fear arise frequently and without reasonable cause.. Symptoms: Palpitations, Sweating, Trembling, Shortness of breath, Fear of losing control, Dizziness. Treatments: Antidepressant medications, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Relaxation Techniques

simplified_explanation: A progressive nervous system disorder that affects movement.

simplified_explanation: An infection of the female reproductive organs.

full_text: Disease: Peptic Ulcer. Also known as: Stomach ulcer. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gastroenterology. Explanation: Open sores that develop on the inside lining of your stomach and the upper portion of your small intestine.

full_text: Disease: Periodontal Disease. Also known as: Gum disease. Category: Global | Sub-category: Dental. Explanation: A serious gum infection that damages the soft tissue and, without treatment, can destroy the bone that supports your teeth.

simplified_explanation: A highly contagious respiratory tract infection that is easily preventable by vaccine.
full_text: Disease: Pertussis. Also known as: Whooping cough, Kali khansi. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A highly contagious respiratory tract infection that is easily preventable by vaccine.

simplified_explanation: An infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs.

Symptoms: Cough, fever, chest pain, difficulty breathing. Treatments: Antibiotics, antiviral medications (if applicable), rest, fluids, symptomatic relief. Precautions: follow up, medication, consult doctor, rest

full_text: Disease: Polio (Poliomyelitis). Also known as: Polio. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A contagious viral illness that in its most severe form causes nerve injury leading to paralysis, difficulty breathing and sometimes death.

simplified_explanation: A hormonal disorder common among women of reproductive age.
full_text: Disease: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS). Also known as: PCOS. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gynecology. Explanation: A hormonal disorder common among women of reproductive age.

simplified_explanation: A mental health condition that's triggered by a terrifying event — either experiencing it or witnessing it.
full_text: Disease: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). Also known as: PTSD. Category: Global | Sub-category: Psychiatry. Explanation: A mental health condition that's triggered by a terrifying event — either experiencing it or witnessing it.

full_text: Disease: Preeclampsia. Category: Global | Sub-category: Obstetrics. Explanation: A pregnancy complication characterized by high blood pressure and signs of damage to another organ system, most often the liver and kidneys.. Symptoms: High blood pressure, proteinuria, swelling, headaches, visual disturbances. Treatments: Bed rest, blood pressure monitoring, frequent prenatal visits, medication (such as antihypertensive drugs), magnesium sulfate (for severe cases), delivery of the baby (in severe cases)

simplified_explanation: Cancer that occurs in the prostate — a small walnut-shaped gland in males that produces the seminal fluid that nourishes and transports sperm.
full_text: Disease: Prostate Cancer. Category: Global | Sub-category: Oncology. Explanation: Cancer that occurs in the prostate — a small walnut-shaped gland in males that produces the seminal fluid that nourishes and transports sperm.

simplified_explanation: A skin disease that causes red, itchy scaly patches, most commonly on the knees, elbows, trunk and scalp.
precautions: wash hands with warm soapy water
full_text: Disease: Psoriasis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Dermatology. Explanation: A skin disease that causes red, itchy scaly patches, most commonly on the knees, elbows, trunk and scalp.. Precautions: stop bleeding using pressure, salt baths, consult doctor, wash hands with warm soapy water

simplified_explanation: A blockage in one of the pulmonary arteries in your lungs, which is usually caused by blood clots that travel to the lungs from deep veins in the legs.
full_text: Disease: Pulmonary Embolism. Category: Global | Sub-category: Pulmonology. Explanation: A blockage in one of the pulmonary arteries in your lungs, which is usually caused by blood clots that travel to the lungs from deep veins in the legs.

simplified_explanation: A deadly virus spread to people from the saliva of infected animals.

full_text: Disease: Rabies. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A deadly virus spread to people from the saliva of infected animals.. Symptoms: Flu-like symptoms (fever, headache, fatigue), anxiety, confusion, hallucinations, difficulty swallowing. Treatments: Immediate medical attention (post-exposure prophylaxis), wound care, administration of rabies vaccine and immunoglobulin, supportive care, monitoring and management of symptoms

simplified_explanation: A condition that causes some areas of your body — such as your fingers and toes — to feel numb and cold in response to cold temperatures or stress.

simplified_explanation: A common fungal skin infection that is not due to a worm.
full_text: Disease: Ringworm. Also known as: Tinea corporis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Dermatology. Explanation: A common fungal skin infection that is not due to a worm.

simplified_explanation: A common skin condition that causes redness and visible blood vessels in your face.
full_text: Disease: Rosacea. Category: Global | Sub-category: Dermatology. Explanation: A common skin condition that causes redness and visible blood vessels in your face.

simplified_explanation: A common bacterial disease that affects the intestinal tract.

full_text: Disease: Scabies. Category: Global | Sub-category: Dermatology. Explanation: An itchy skin condition caused by a tiny burrowing mite.. Symptoms: Sore throat, fever, rash (red, sandpaper-like), swollen glands. Treatments: Antibiotics (such as penicillin or erythromycin), rest, fluids, symptomatic relief

simplified_explanation: A serious mental disorder in which people interpret reality abnormally.
